loop2-father1.text: It's good to finally see you.
For a moment I thought you would never appear!
But don't worry, you are here now and that's what matters.
I'm sure you will have a lovely time here.
Take your time to enjoy every corner of the place,
there is no need to rush!

loop2-father2.text: Ahhh, that's good. Just the right temperature.
I'm sure one could rest in these waters for hours and hours.

loop2-father3.text: Oh, are you getting out of the water? So fast?
Was the water not to your liking? That's a shame...

loop2-father4.text: Are you leaving already? I'd hope you stay a bit longer here.

loop3-father1.text: Oh, thank goodness, you are back.
There's no need to rush, is there?
You may miss some nice things in here if you run around like that, you know?

loop3-father2.text: Oh! uh… That is not supposed to be there.
I'm sorry for that, I don't know how it got there.

loop3-father3.text: Families are such a waste, aren't they?

I'd rather stay here forever in the calm and quiet waters,
with no one to bother me at all...

loop3-father4.text: Do you like it? It's a wonderful piece, I think.

I wrote it myself and dare I say it,
I am a master of my craft!

loop3-father5.text: I think you might have touched something by mistake.
Could you put it back on?

loop3-father6.text:
I don't think you can enjoy a sunrise as beautiful
as this one anywhere else, honestly.
Makes me want to come sit here every day to see it.

loop3-father7.text: You aren't planning to leave again, are you?

Everything is perfect here, why would you
even consider leaving this place?
Stay, please! Just a bit more!

loop3-narrator1.text: I pray to god these subtitles work.

To whoever, if anyone, is hearing this.
I need your help, please.

loop3-narrator2.text:
I was supposed to go work as the narrator of
a game called Just Passing Through,
but someone got in the way and trapped me in here.
I don't know where I am...

loop4-father1.text: Well, hopefully now you won't just leave again.

I have to admit I am a bit hurt
that you left like that.

loop4-father2.text:
You have the music, you have the nice warm waters,
you have the views from the windows...

I am at a loss, honestly.
What more could you ask for?

loop4-father3.text: Is it me? Am I the problem?
I am trying to do my best for you, you know?

loop4-father4.text:
A letter? Don't mind those things,
it probably didn't say anything important.

Now please let's go back to the other room,
I want to hear some more of that music.

loop5-father1.text: What… What is going on? Can you hear me??
You shouldn't have left, now look at what happened.

loop5-father2.text:
This is all your fault!
You are ruining everything!

loop6-father1.text: You can still fix this, you know?

I don't know what you are thinking but
I implore you, just stop going forward.

loop6-father2.text:
Stop, do not continue.
There is no going back if you continue.

I know the previous place was way better
but here you still have some good things.

loop6-father3.text:
Stop going forward!
You are going the wrong way!

loop6-father4.text:
They are not who they say they are,
you never had a mother.

loop6-father5.text:
I tried everything I could.
Do I mean that little to you?
This is all because you refused to listen to me and continued being stubborn.

loop6-father6.text: What have I done for you to hate me this much?

Do you want to leave me that much?
You enjoy making me suffer, right?
